Description: Solid-cast amuletic figure of a composite deity in copper alloy; winged standing naked figure with both arms along body, wearing conical headdress; suspension loop at rear; flat solid-cast; details of figure very worn off; corroded.
Curator's comments: This bronze depicting a hybrid god is unique in the corpus of Naukratis (drawing published in Petrie 1886, pl. XX, no. 1). Parallels for composite winged deity in copper alloy are found in Tanis, the Memphite region and Athribis (Weiss 2012, 204-207, 670-671, Typ 109, Taf. 29h). Petrie, W. M. F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I., 1884-5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Weiss, K. 2012, Ägyptische Tier- und Götterbronzen aus Unterägypten: Untersuchungen zu Typus, Ikonographie und Funktion sowie der Bedeutung innerhalb der Kulturkontakte zu Griechenland, Ägypten und Altes Testament 81.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XX, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (MB.192) (phase 3)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Egypt Exploration Fund (Committee of)
